title: What countries would you consider to be true democracies? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: If by “democracy”, you mean representative democracy, then any in the top part of the following indexes/rankings: Democracy Index 2019Human Freedom IndexFreedom in the World2020 World Press Freedom Index | Reporters Without BordersThese are just some of them, in no particular order: Konungariket Sverige (Kingdom of Sweden)Democracy Index: Full Democracy — 9.39Freedom in the World: Free (¹⁰⁰/₁₀₀)Human Freedom: 8.50World Press Freedom Index: 4thKongeriket Norge (Kingdom of Norway)Democracy Index: Full Democracy — 9.87Freedom in the World: Free (¹⁰⁰/₁₀₀)Human Freedom: 8.44World Press Freedom Index: 1stNew Zealand · AotearoaDemocracy Index: Full Democracy — 9.26Freedom in the World: Free (⁹⁷/₁₀₀)Human Freedom: 8.88World Press Freedom Index: 9thÍsland (Iceland)Democracy Index: Full Democracy — 9.58Freedom in the World: Free (⁹⁴/₁₀₀)Human Freedom: 8.41World Press Freedom Index: 15thSuomen tasavalta (Republic of Finland)Democracy Index: Full Democracy — 9.25Freedom in the World: Free (¹⁰⁰/₁₀₀)Human Freedom: 8.53World Press Freedom Index: 2ndThere are other metrics out there that can also be used, like the happiness index, but that’s not what I’ve chosen and those are within the top 20 countries in the metrics I’ve listed. However, either way those examples apparently are probably the best countries out there as they are very free, democratic, and have good economies.

I would consider being true democracies those countries that are ranked by the EIU's Democracy Index as 'Full Democracies'. Why? Because those 'nations have only limited problems in democratic functioning', whereas other democracies have more flaws. Some mentioned the UK and Switzerland, and those two countries are indeed ranked as full democracies alongside 20 other countries (and no, the United States is not one of them). Somebody said that democracy is a flawed idea. Yes, it is! But is there any idea that does not have some sort of flaw? That is why I like the definition of a full democracy when it says that it has only limited problems, etc. Which country is considered to be the top democracy in the world? The answer is Norway.
